intro: Euphorbia gasparrinii subsp. samnitica, commonly known as the Southern Italian spurge, is a perennial shrub native to southern Italy. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often spiny stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
